-K0jLdEjdQADNN5TbjVy.notes: Top fermenting yeast with a soft bread-like character. Leaves a sweet, mildly estery finish. Delicious Belgian character to any beer. Great in Wit style with coriander and bitter orange peel.

-K0jLdEkvmpsZOAUMYQ4.name: Belgian Wheat Yeast
-K0jLdEkvmpsZOAUMYQ4.notes: Estery lor phenol yeast. Plum and apple aroma with a dry finish.

-K0jLdElIxOXbmcDenlL.name: Belgian Wit Ale
-K0jLdElIxOXbmcDenlL.notes: Phenolic and tart. The original yeast used to produce Wit in Belgium.

-K0jLdEoJ3nRUBzVCYD0.bestFor: Belgian Wit, Spiced Ale, Wheat Ales and Specialty Beers
-K0jLdEoJ3nRUBzVCYD0.name: Belgian Wit II
-K0jLdEoJ3nRUBzVCYD0.notes: Less phenolic than WLP400 (Belgian Wit Ale) but more spicy. Leaves a little more sweetness and flocculation is higher than WLP400.

-K0jLdEpi-e24sJkX72Y.name: Belgian Witbier
-K0jLdEpi-e24sJkX72Y.notes: Tart, slightly phenolic character. For Wits and Grand Cru. Tolerates high gravity beers well.

-K0jLdEr1l4JDOaFdlkQ.bestFor: Bohemian Pilsners, Pilsners, German Helles, Bocks
-K0jLdEr1l4JDOaFdlkQ.name: Bohemian Lager
-K0jLdEr1l4JDOaFdlkQ.notes: Ferments clean and malty, with rich malty flavor for full gravity pilsners.

-K0jLdEs-EILJAB-XQEI.bestFor: Belgian Lambic, Gueze Lambic, and Sour Browns
-K0jLdEs-EILJAB-XQEI.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
-K0jLdEs-EILJAB-XQEI.notes: Wild yeast strain isolated from Brussels region of Belgium. Adds classic sweaty horse hair flavor as well as sourness and cherry-pie like flavor. Generally used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae after the primary fermentation has begun. Requires 3-6 mo

-K0jLdEtGavFDIXa9xfU.name: Brettanomyces Lambicus
-K0jLdEtGavFDIXa9xfU.notes: Wild yeast strain associated with Belgian breweries. Contributes horsey, old leather flavor complex to Belgian lambics. Slow growing yeast that takes weeks to ferment and months to develop fully.

-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr7.bestFor: Excellent for all English style ales including bitters, pale ale, porters and brown ale.
-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr7.name: British Ale
-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr7.notes: This yeast has higher attenuation than the White Labs English Ale yeast strains. Produces a malty flavored beer.

-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr8.bestFor: All British Ales, Pales, Bitters, English Strong Ale
-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr8.name: British Ale Yeast
-K0jLdEu9M86nUtoAsr8.notes: Fruity, tart, dry crisp finish. Very well balanced.

-K0jLdEvwt8DEztu_8T7.bestFor: British and Canadian Ales, English Bitters
-K0jLdEvwt8DEztu_8T7.name: British Ale II
-K0jLdEvwt8DEztu_8T7.notes: Malty, clean, crisp finish. Dry flavor.

-K0jLdEvwt8DEztu_8T8.name: British Cask Ale
-K0jLdEvwt8DEztu_8T8.notes: A great choice for any cask conditioned British Ale.  Produces nice malt profile with a hint of fruit. Finishes dry and slightly tart.

-K0jLdExMm5ABO3yt23l.name: British Draft Ale
-K0jLdExMm5ABO3yt23l.notes: Full bodied, well rounded ale yeast with a touch of diacytl. Emphasizes malt character. Great for porters and bitters.

-K0jLdEy0rPxwY2612yC.name: British Microbrewery Ale
-K0jLdEy0rPxwY2612yC.notes: Complex oakey, and fruity ester profile. Slightly under-attenuated finish leaves some residual malt flavor. Suitable for low to medium gravity bitters and ales.

-K0jLdEzFqXb4FkzfzBW.name: British Pale Ale #1
-K0jLdEzFqXb4FkzfzBW.notes: Bold, citrusy character which accentuates mineral and hop flavors. Distinct character of a classic Pale Ale.

-K0jLdF0-oy5c8lo4B2R.bestFor: British Pale Ale, other British Ales
-K0jLdF0-oy5c8lo4B2R.name: British Pale Ale #2
-K0jLdF0-oy5c8lo4B2R.notes: Smooth, full bodied, well roundd ale yeast. Mild esters. Strong ferementer suitable for strong or spiced ales. Accentuates caramel and malt flavors.

-K0jLdF11xQ0QwLNqBxA.name: British Real Ale
-K0jLdF11xQ0QwLNqBxA.notes: Great for real pub bitters. Has a complex, woody flavor and musty ester profile that characterizes real ale. Underattenuating to leave mild sweetness to the finish.

-K0jLdF2NaUbRMbmFN6u.bestFor: Bohemian Pilsner, Classic Pilsners, Dortmunder and Light Lagers
-K0jLdF2NaUbRMbmFN6u.name: Budvar Lager
-K0jLdF2NaUbRMbmFN6u.notes: Classic pilsner lager yeast. Malty nose and subtle fruit. Rich malt profile, but dry crisp finish. Hop character accentuated by dry finish.

-K0jLdF38lkUTIsNfNqb.bestFor: All English styles including Pale Ale, IPA, Porter, Stout and Bitters.
-K0jLdF38lkUTIsNfNqb.name: Burton Ale
-K0jLdF38lkUTIsNfNqb.notes: Burton-on-trent yeast produces a complex character. Flavors include apple, pear, and clover honey.

-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x-.bestFor: American Style Ales, Ambers, Pale Ales, Brown Ale, Strong Ale
-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x-.name: California Ale
-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x-.notes: Very clean flavor, balance and stability. Accentuates hop flavor Versitile - can be used to make any style ale.

-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x0.bestFor: American style Pales, Ambers, Browns, IPAs, American Strong Ale
-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x0.name: California Ale V
-K0jLdF48_CFSfBuX5x0.notes: Similar to White Labs California Ale Yeast, but slightly lower attenuation leaves a fuller bodied beer.

-K0jLdF5GGov3lk8xDc8.bestFor: California Common Beer, American or Robust porters
-K0jLdF5GGov3lk8xDc8.name: California Esteem (Gold)
-K0jLdF5GGov3lk8xDc8.notes: Use for California Common Beers (aka Steam Beer). Leaves a slightly estery, well attenuated finish. Quite distinct in flavor. Can also be used for complex porters.

-K0jLdF5GGov3lk8xDc9.name: California Lager
-K0jLdF5GGov3lk8xDc9.notes: Suited for 19th century California style beers. Lagers at high temperature and produces malty, clear beers.

-K0jLdF6W8SakQo59U0D.bestFor: Light Canadian Ales, Bitish Bitter, Pale Ale, Porters
-K0jLdF6W8SakQo59U0D.name: Canadian Ale
-K0jLdF6W8SakQo59U0D.notes: Clean, strong fermenting, well attenuated ale yeast that leaves a pleasant, fruity, complex finish.

-K0jLdF7XArHRicTPvuR.name: Champagne Yeast
-K0jLdF7XArHRicTPvuR.notes: Can tolerate alcohol up to 17%. For Barley Wine or Meads.

-K0jLdF8AHuyvvofxkmy.name: Classic British Ale
-K0jLdF8AHuyvvofxkmy.notes: Complex ale with British tones and fruit like esters. Works well in high gravity ales such as scottish heavy as well.

-K0jLdF9DLCfh-v9Qh3q.name: Cooper Ale
-K0jLdF9DLCfh-v9Qh3q.notes: General purpose dry ale yeast with a very good reputation. Produces significant fruity flavors. No phenolics. Clean, fruity finish.

-K0jLdFAarFW0Ub5Zxjq.bestFor: All American Style Lagers -- both light and dark.
-K0jLdFAarFW0Ub5Zxjq.name: Cry Havoc
-K0jLdFAarFW0Ub5Zxjq.notes: Licensed by White Labs from Charlie Papazian, author of "The Complete Joy of Home Brewing". This yeast was used to brew many of his original recipes. Diverse strain can ferment at ale and lager temps.

-K0jLdFBkoTkyvU_btaX.name: Czech Budejovice Lager
-K0jLdFBkoTkyvU_btaX.notes: Dry and crisp with low diacetyl production. From Southern Czech Republic.

-K0jLdFCZSMEhcB2AGFZ.bestFor: Bohemian and American Pilsner, Bocks, Oktoberfest, Marzen
-K0jLdFCZSMEhcB2AGFZ.name: Czech Pilsner Lager
-K0jLdFCZSMEhcB2AGFZ.notes: Classic Pilsner strain. Creates a dry but malty finish. Perfect for Pilsners and bocks. Some sulfur produced, but will fade with time.

-K0jLdFCZSMEhcB2AGF_.name: Danish Lager
-K0jLdFCZSMEhcB2AGF_.notes: Rich, Dortmund style, with a crisp, dry finish. Soft profile accentuates hop flavor.

-K0jLdFDDBF3atQfam3O.name: Doric Ale
-K0jLdFDDBF3atQfam3O.notes: Good reputation. Reliable clean finish for a dry yeast.

-K0jLdFEQ8aBgUhhNdgh.bestFor: Pale Ales, Amber, ESB, Brown Ales, Strong Ales
-K0jLdFEQ8aBgUhhNdgh.name: Dry English Ale
-K0jLdFEQ8aBgUhhNdgh.notes: Clean, Highly flocculant, and highly attentive yeast. Similar to White labs English Ale yeast, but more attentive. Suitable for high gravity ales.

-K0jLdFFyR5r7tzYmyhQ.bestFor: Alt biers, Dusseldorf Alts, German Ales
-K0jLdFFyR5r7tzYmyhQ.name: Dusseldorf Alt Yeast
-K0jLdFFyR5r7tzYmyhQ.notes: Traditional Alt yeast from Dusseldorf, Germany. Produces clean, slightly sweet alt beers. Does not accentuate hop flavor like WLP029 does.

-K0jLdFGcq9BzMTkPDL7.bestFor: American Ales, Golden ales, Blonde Ale, Pale Ale and German Alt styles
-K0jLdFGcq9BzMTkPDL7.name: East Coast Ale
-K0jLdFGcq9BzMTkPDL7.notes: White labs "Brewer Patriot" strain can be used to reproduce many of the American versions of classic beer styles. Very clean with low esters.

-K0jLdFJAJRDwowaDSfr.name: East European Lager
-K0jLdFJAJRDwowaDSfr.notes: Smooth, rich, creamy character. Emphasizes big malt flavor and clean finish. Full but smooth malt character.

-K0jLdFKQItbYnLP4yKt.bestFor: Strong Scottish style ales, ESB, Irish Reds
-K0jLdFKQItbYnLP4yKt.name: Edinburgh Ale
-K0jLdFKQItbYnLP4yKt.notes: Malty strong ale yeast. Reproduces complex, malty, flavorful schottish ales. Hop character comes through well.

-K0jLdFMUq5bD2m35ZFu.name: Edme Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFMUq5bD2m35ZFu.notes: Quick starting dry yeast with a good reputation. Produces some fruity ester. Highly attentive, so it will likely produce a slightly dry taste.

-K0jLdFNA83gyCiHyyNL.bestFor: English Pale Ale, ESB, India Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Porter, Sweet Stouts and Strong Ales
-K0jLdFNA83gyCiHyyNL.name: English Ale
-K0jLdFNA83gyCiHyyNL.notes: Classic ESB strain best for English style milds, bitters, porters and English style stouts. Leaves a clear beer with some residual sweetness.

-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9od.bestFor: Cider, Wine and High Gravity Beer
-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9od.name: English Cider Yeast
-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9od.notes: Classic Cider yeast. Ferments dry, but retains apple flavor. Some sulfer produced during fermentation will fade with age.

-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9oe.bestFor: British milds, pale ales, bitters, stouts.
-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9oe.name: Essex Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFP2qj92ZAfS9oe.notes: Flavorful British yeast with a drier finish than many ale yeasts. Bready and fruity in character. Well suited for top cropping (collecting). Does not flocculate as much as WLP005 or WLP002.

-K0jLdFQmas0UWKHgyTp.bestFor: Alt, Kolsch, malty English Ales, Fruit beers
-K0jLdFQmas0UWKHgyTp.name: European Ale
-K0jLdFQmas0UWKHgyTp.notes: Malty, Northern European ale yeast. Low ester production, low sulfer, gives a clean profile. Low attenuation contributes to malty taste.

-K0jLdFSQa3i9nA8gapL.bestFor: European Ales, German Ales, Alts, Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Kolsch
-K0jLdFSQa3i9nA8gapL.name: European Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFSQa3i9nA8gapL.notes: Very malty flavor characteristic of Bavarian/Munich Ales. Complex character.

-K0jLdFTBR2gENHjcFTe.bestFor: Bohemian Pilsner, American Pilsner, Helles, Dunkel
-K0jLdFTBR2gENHjcFTe.name: European Lager II
-K0jLdFTBR2gENHjcFTe.notes: Clean, dry flavor profile for aggressively hopped pilsners. Dry finish, mild aroma, slight sulfur production.

-K0jLdFUGYyeSCxXeLRh.name: Forbidden Fruit
-K0jLdFUGYyeSCxXeLRh.notes: Phenolic profile with subdued fruitiness. Available seasonally.

-K0jLdFVtczfcRsvMTdM.bestFor: American Amber, Brown, IPA, Pale ales and stouts. Blondes and fruit beers.
-K0jLdFVtczfcRsvMTdM.name: GF All American Ale
-K0jLdFVtczfcRsvMTdM.notes: Popular all purpose American ale style now in a Gluten Free strain. Produces beers that are nutty, clean with a slight tart finish. Ferment warmer to accentuate hops and add fruitiness or ferment cold for clean light citrus character.

-K0jLdFW37ZKLjnv4kc_.bestFor: German Ales, Alts, Kolsch, Dry Stout
-K0jLdFW37ZKLjnv4kc_.name: German Ale
-K0jLdFW37ZKLjnv4kc_.notes: Crisp, dry finish with a mild flavor.

-K0jLdFXzzzRpg3oqmEg.bestFor: Kolsch, Alt and German Pale Ales
-K0jLdFXzzzRpg3oqmEg.name: German Ale II
-K0jLdFXzzzRpg3oqmEg.notes: Strong sulfer component will reduce with aging. Clean flavor, but with more ester production than regular German Ale Yeast.

-K0jLdFYDADSbCgP1Lfs.bestFor: Kolsch, Altbiers, Pale Ales, Blonde and Honey Ales
-K0jLdFYDADSbCgP1Lfs.name: German Ale/Kolsch
-K0jLdFYDADSbCgP1Lfs.notes: Great for light beers. Accentuates hop flavors. Slight sulfer flavor will fade with age and leave a clean, lager like ale.

-K0jLdFZNFnWMyB0N2Rc.bestFor: Bocks, Doppelbocks, Oktoberfest, Vienna, Helles, some American Pilsners
-K0jLdFZNFnWMyB0N2Rc.name: German Bock Lager
-K0jLdFZNFnWMyB0N2Rc.notes: Produces beer that has balanced malt and hop character. From Southern Bavaria.

-K0jLdFaLy5oAfogsX0r.bestFor: German Marzen, Pilsner, Lagers, Oktoberfest beers.
-K0jLdFaLy5oAfogsX0r.name: German Lager
-K0jLdFaLy5oAfogsX0r.notes: Very malty and clean. One of the world's most popular lager yeasts.

-K0jLdFbNUkLBiQZLP-C.bestFor: Weiss, Weizen, other Southern German Wheat styles
-K0jLdFbNUkLBiQZLP-C.name: German Weiss
-K0jLdFbNUkLBiQZLP-C.notes: Milder than German Wheat #1, this strain still produces the desired clove and phenol character, but to a lesser degree. Full, earthy character.

-K0jLdFcWYFKCxJzB2wu.name: German Wheat BT
-K0jLdFcWYFKCxJzB2wu.notes: Top fermenting Weizenbier yeast. Intensely spicy, clovey and phenolic. High attenuation.

-K0jLdFdx2tc4-pU2rN0.name: German Wheat
-K0jLdFdx2tc4-pU2rN0.notes: Subtle flavor profile. Sharp, fruity, crisp, sherry like flavor.

-K0jLdFeeToYW54q8hEB.bestFor: German style wheat beers. Weiss, Weizen, Hefeweizen
-K0jLdFeeToYW54q8hEB.name: Hefeweizen Ale
-K0jLdFeeToYW54q8hEB.notes: Produces the banana and clove nose traditionally associated with German Wheat beers. Also produces desired cloudy look.

-K0jLdFfx2Ln3ThRKRnp.name: Hefeweizen IV Ale
-K0jLdFfx2Ln3ThRKRnp.notes: Large clove and phenolic aroma, but with minimal banana flavor. Citrus and apricot notes. Crisp and drinkable, with some sulfur production.

-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg0.bestFor: Irish Ales, Stouts, Porters, Browns, Reds and Pale Ale
-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg0.name: Irish Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg0.notes: Excellent for Irish Stouts. Produces slight hint of diacetyl balanced by a light fruitiness and a slightly dry crispness.

-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg1.bestFor: Irish Dry Stouts, Porter, Scottish Ale, Brown Ale, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine
-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg1.name: Irish Ale
-K0jLdFgxUVBc8keOwg1.notes: Dry diacetyl, fruity flavor characteristic of stouts. Full bodied, dry, clean flavor.

-K0jLdFlZsRxS3CSaOyQ.name: Irish Dry Stout
-K0jLdFlZsRxS3CSaOyQ.notes: Top fermenting yeast which leaves a recognizable slightly woody character to Dry Stouts. Vinous almost lactic character that blends well with roast malts. High attenuation.

-K0jLdFmKRyA87ijVyyb.bestFor: Bitters, milds, porters stouts and scottish ale styles.
-K0jLdFmKRyA87ijVyyb.name: Klassic Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFmKRyA87ijVyyb.notes: Traditional English Ale style yeast. Produces ester character, and allows hop flavor through. Leaves a slightly sweet malt character in ales.

-K0jLdFnPcDRrGysKBzm.name: Kolsch
-K0jLdFnPcDRrGysKBzm.notes: Produces mild sulfer flavor which smooths with time to a clean attenuated flavor. Mineral and malt characters come through well. Clean, lightly yeasty flavor and aroma in the finish.

-K0jLdFotBBubpoBN601.name: Kolsch Yeast
-K0jLdFotBBubpoBN601.notes: Very malty flavor with mix of lager and ale character. Crisp, clean finish.

-K0jLdFp9UPEOlhoHEq2.bestFor: Belgian gueze, lambic, sour brown ales, and Berliner Weisse.
-K0jLdFp9UPEOlhoHEq2.name: Lactobacillus Delbrueckii
-K0jLdFp9UPEOlhoHEq2.notes: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Produces mild acidity and sourness found in many types of Belgian beers. Always used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae and wild yeasts.

-K0jLdFqX-8KbDfgrU67.bestFor: Souvingnon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Seyval.
-K0jLdFqX-8KbDfgrU67.name: Lalvin - K1V-1116
-K0jLdFqX-8KbDfgrU67.notes: Used for white grape varieties. Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Capable of surviving difficult conditions such as low nutrient or high SO2 levels. Has low volatile action.

-K0jLdFrwr-36XJR3R2L.bestFor: Young wines such as nouveau, blush and sugar white.
-K0jLdFrwr-36XJR3R2L.name: Lalvin 71B-1122
-K0jLdFrwr-36XJR3R2L.notes: Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Ability to metabolize high amounts (20-40%) of malic acid. Partial metabolism of malic acid helps soften the wine. May produce significant esters, making it a good choice for concentrates.

-K0jLdFsx8i9AyLsM0Hu.bestFor: White wines such as Chardonnay and Rose. Also good for mead.
-K0jLdFsx8i9AyLsM0Hu.name: Lalvin D-47
-K0jLdFsx8i9AyLsM0Hu.notes: Recommended for white variety wines such as Chardonnay and Rose as well as Mead. Low foaming, quick fermenting, forming a compact lees at the end of fermentation. Use yeast nutrients if making mead. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.

-K0jLdFtDcjRSG-_W_5y.bestFor: All types of wine and also cider.
-K0jLdFtDcjRSG-_W_5y.name: Lalvin EC-1118
-K0jLdFtDcjRSG-_W_5y.notes: Low production of foam, volatile acid and H2S. Ferments over a wide temperature range. High alcohol tolerance, compact lees and good flocculation. Relatively neutral flavor and aroma.

-K0jLdFtDcjRSG-_W_5z.name: Lalvin RC 212 (Bourgovin)
-K0jLdFtDcjRSG-_W_5z.notes: RC212 recommended for red variety wines and high gravity beers. Alcohol tolerance in the 12-14% range. Low foaming and moderate speed fermenting. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.

-K0jLdFu20swtPs9d3Zm.name: London
-K0jLdFu20swtPs9d3Zm.notes: Produces a clean, well balanced ale. Medium attenuation preserves some beer complexity.

-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIG.bestFor: Classic British Pale Ales, Bitters and Stouts
-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIG.name: London Ale
-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIG.notes: Dry, malty ale yeast. Produces a complex, oak flavored ester character. Hop bitterness comes through well.

-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIH.bestFor: English Ales, Bitters, IPAs, Brown Ale
-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIH.name: London Ale Yeast
-K0jLdFvYBSMQNnEWzIH.notes: Dry finish, bold, rich flavor, some fruit profile and a crisp finish.

-K0jLdFwyI5mjDdHC50T.name: London Ale III
-K0jLdFwyI5mjDdHC50T.notes: Light, fruity flavor. Balanced flavor with hint of sweetness.

-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCU.bestFor: English Bitters, IPA, Brown Ales, Mild Ales
-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCU.name: London ESB Ale
-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCU.notes: Malty, balanced flavor. Fruity, rich finish. Excellent for cask conditioned ales and bitters.

-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCV.bestFor: Complex, full bodied Porters, Stouts, Ales.
-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCV.name: Manchester
-K0jLdFxU_uunwSPGPCV.notes: Old english style ale yeast that produces a complex, woody, full bodied ale at warm temperature. Medium attenuation. Good dry yeast for many english styles.

-K0jLdFyqIYIMrSez3E3.bestFor: Mexican style light and dark lagers.
-K0jLdFyqIYIMrSez3E3.name: Mexican Lager
-K0jLdFyqIYIMrSez3E3.notes: From Mexico City - produces a clean lager beer with a crisp finish. Good for mexican style beers.

-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVk.bestFor: Pilsners, Light Lagers, Dortmond/Export, Marzen/Oktoberfest, Dunkel
-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVk.name: Munich Lager
-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVk.notes: Unique Pilsner strain. Very smooth, well-rounded and full bodied. Benefits from a diacetyl rest.

-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVl.bestFor: High attenuation yeast good for most ales.
-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVl.name: Munton Fison Ale
-K0jLdFz4ZbjwrK0_AVl.notes: Quick starting dry yeast. Produces some fuity esters. High attenuation produces clean finish.

-K0jLdG-GtRtGH6Rwoj7.bestFor: American Pilsner, California Common, Canadian Lager, Oktoberfest, Marzen
-K0jLdG-GtRtGH6Rwoj7.name: North American Lager
-K0jLdG-GtRtGH6Rwoj7.notes: American and Canadian lager yeast. Malty finish makes it suitable for Marzens/Oktoberfest as well.

-K0jLdG0OLDaOgsvxd1C.bestFor: German pilsners, Mexican and Canadian Lagers
-K0jLdG0OLDaOgsvxd1C.name: Northern German Lager
-K0jLdG0OLDaOgsvxd1C.notes: Clean, crisp, traditional lager character. Strong fermenting and forgiving yeast. Excellent general purpose lager yeast.

-K0jLdG3UJ-9DCSkVbYi.bestFor: Oregon Ales, All American Ale styles
-K0jLdG3UJ-9DCSkVbYi.name: Northwest Ale
-K0jLdG3UJ-9DCSkVbYi.notes: Classic Northwest US ale yeast. Slight fruit flavor, malty ale with good body and balance.

-K0jLdG53Do-TWfCMLLq.name: Noth-Eastern Micro Ale
-K0jLdG53Do-TWfCMLLq.notes: Malty, bready, yet clean malt character. Leaves hops flavor and aroma intact. Versitile yeast for many American styles.

-K0jLdG6ob9Bp8JeNJJi.name: Nottingham
-K0jLdG6ob9Bp8JeNJJi.notes: Dry strain is highly flocculant and has high attenuation. Produces relatively few fruity esters for a dry yeast. Can be fermented at low temperature to produce lager-style beers.

-K0jLdG6ob9Bp8JeNJJj.bestFor: British ales, pale ales, ambers, porters and stouts.
-K0jLdG6ob9Bp8JeNJJj.name: Nottingham Ale Yeast
-K0jLdG6ob9Bp8JeNJJj.notes: British style of ale yeast with a very dry finish and high attenuation. Medium to low fruit and fusel alcohol production. Good top fermenting yeast for cropping.

-K0jLdG8UVQV7yMGT_6f.name: Nottingham Yeast
-K0jLdG8UVQV7yMGT_6f.notes: High flocculation - settles quickly. Very good reputation as a fast starter and quick fermenter. Clean and only slightly fruity. Some nutty flavor in bottled version. Relatively high attenuation.

-K0jLdG9k2Ol0BL8YTKN.bestFor: Marzen, Oktoberfest, European Lagers, Bocks, Munich Helles
-K0jLdG9k2Ol0BL8YTKN.name: Octoberfest/Marzen Lager
-K0jLdG9k2Ol0BL8YTKN.notes: Produces a malty, bock style beer. Does not finish as dry or as fast as White's German Lager yeast. Longer lagering or starter recommended.

-K0jLdGAE0p8BV06f8CB.name: Old Bavarian Lager
-K0jLdGAE0p8BV06f8CB.notes: Well rounded, malty with a subtle ester complex and citrus flavors. Distinct, flavorful yeast is great for Southern German lager styles.

-K0jLdGE34FaMStso1rE.bestFor: Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bock and Dark Lagers.
-K0jLdGE34FaMStso1rE.name: Old Bavarian Lager
-K0jLdGE34FaMStso1rE.notes: Southern Germany/Bavarian lager yeast. Finishes malty with a slight ester profile.

-K0jLdGFxchijej_sHk-.bestFor: Altbier, German ales, some Wheat beers.
-K0jLdGFxchijej_sHk-.name: Old German Ale
-K0jLdGFxchijej_sHk-.notes: Traditional Alt Bier flavor. Strong fermenter with a smooth, attenuated, mild flavor. Slightly dry, clean, quenching finish.

-K0jLdGIncvuBIia306g.name: Original Pilsner
-K0jLdGIncvuBIia306g.notes: Full bodied lager yeast with sweet, underattenuated finish. Subdued diacetyl character. Big malty palatte. Classic Pilsner finish and style.

-K0jLdGJYJntw3j742ck.bestFor: English & American ales including milds, bitters, IPA, porters and English stouts.
-K0jLdGJYJntw3j742ck.name: Pacific Ale
-K0jLdGJYJntw3j742ck.notes: Popular yeast from the Pacific Northwest. Leaves a clear and malty profile. More fruity than WLP002. Suitable for many English and American styles.

-K0jLdGK2HUm_FzIyyoO.bestFor: Meads, Barleywines, Imperial Stouts and high gravity ales.
-K0jLdGK2HUm_FzIyyoO.name: Pasteur Champagne
-K0jLdGK2HUm_FzIyyoO.notes: High attenuation dry yeast. Good reputation. Good for Meads and other high gravity ales.

-K0jLdGMWcbNr7SUgy9D.name: Pediococcus Cerevisiae
-K0jLdGMWcbNr7SUgy9D.notes: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Creates a high level of lactic acidity over a long time. Often used with other yeasts, and it may take several months for flavor to fully develop.

-K0jLdGONuul5NBdt2_j.name: Pediococcus Damnosus
-K0jLdGONuul5NBdt2_j.notes: Slow growing bacteria used in secondary to create lactic acid flavor in Belgian lambics. Produces large amounts of lactic acid and diacytl. Prefers anaerobic conditions.

-K0jLdGQtMqWtNpTy5JK.bestFor: American Pilsner, Bohemian Pilsner, Light Lagers
-K0jLdGQtMqWtNpTy5JK.name: Pilsen Lager
-K0jLdGQtMqWtNpTy5JK.notes: Classic American pilsner strain. Smooth with a malty flavor. Dry and crisp fermentation.

-K0jLdGR8AQJntOtbz3Y.name: Pilsner Lager
-K0jLdGR8AQJntOtbz3Y.notes: Classic pilsner strain from Czech Republic. Dry with a malty finish.

-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eH.bestFor: All English ales including bitters, milds, ESB, Porter, Stout and Barley Wine
-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eH.name: Premium Bitter Ale
-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eH.notes: From Staffordshire England. Mild, but complex estery flavor. High attenuation - ferments strong and dry. Suitable for high gravity beers.

-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eI.bestFor: High attenuation ales with a dry clean taste.
-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eI.name: Red Star Ale
-K0jLdGSWcD4US4aB8eI.notes: Good general purpose dry yeast. Change to a different strain in recent years has improved overall quality.

-K0jLdGTiEG1gP9-3LxJ.name: Ringwood Ale
-K0jLdGTiEG1gP9-3LxJ.notes: European ale yeast. Highly flocculant with complex, clear, but malty profile. Slightly fruity ester.

-K0jLdGVT9SfqzK6368u.bestFor: Belgian sour brown and red beers.
-K0jLdGVT9SfqzK6368u.name: Roselare Belgian Blend
-K0jLdGVT9SfqzK6368u.notes: Culture of Saccharomyces, Brettonomyces and Lactic Acid Bacteria. Complex aromas and flavors. May be used for primary fermentation. Primarily for sour brown and red Belgian styles.

-K0jLdGYbsTvw8m9YDvh.name: SafAle English Ale
-K0jLdGYbsTvw8m9YDvh.notes: Fast starting, fast fermenting yeast. Quick attenuation helps to produce a clean, crisp, clear ale. Can be used in a wide range of ales.

-K0jLdGauzSxJ9BAAMHB.bestFor: High attenuation ales, wheat beers and weizens.
-K0jLdGauzSxJ9BAAMHB.name: SafAle German Ale
-K0jLdGauzSxJ9BAAMHB.notes: Low sedimentation yeast, sometimes used in open fermentation. Good for wheat beers, weizens and light ales.

-K0jLdGc2D0fikmqaLJ6.name: SafBrew Ale
-K0jLdGc2D0fikmqaLJ6.notes: General purpose ale yeast, widely used. Very consistent, clean finish. High attenuation and good flavor profile.

-K0jLdGd7aPUuEwTka-4.name: SafBrew Specialty Ale
-K0jLdGd7aPUuEwTka-4.notes: Estery, somewhat spicy ale yeast. Solid yeast formation at end of fermentation. Widely used for bottle and cask conditioning.

-K0jLdGea0osgbEM4ga4.bestFor: Wide range of lagers and pilsners.
-K0jLdGea0osgbEM4ga4.name: SafLager German Lager
-K0jLdGea0osgbEM4ga4.notes: Popular lager yeast strain. Produces wide range of continental lagers and pilsners. Clean finish.

-K0jLdGea0osgbEM4ga5.name: SafLager West European Lager
-K0jLdGea0osgbEM4ga5.notes: German lager yeast strain. Performs well at low temperature. High flocculation and attenuation for a clean German finish.

-K0jLdGfBI5FhKGyZpBm.bestFor: French or Belgian Ales and Grand Cru styles.
-K0jLdGfBI5FhKGyZpBm.name: Saison
-K0jLdGfBI5FhKGyZpBm.notes: Pleasant yeast blend. Leaves a smooth full character to the malt with mild, but pleasant esters and some apple pie spices.

-K0jLdGgg2a94ztK2tww.bestFor: California and Premium Lagers, all American Lagers
-K0jLdGgg2a94ztK2tww.name: San Francisco Lager

-K0jLdGh9ob_W8iKgDnv.bestFor: Scottish Ale, Scottish Strong Ales, Sweet Stout, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine
-K0jLdGh9ob_W8iKgDnv.name: Scottish Ale

-K0jLdGilOUB43acHMg1.bestFor: German Pilsner, Helles, Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bocks
-K0jLdGilOUB43acHMg1.name: Southern German Lager
-K0jLdGilOUB43acHMg1.notes: Malty finish and balanced aroma. Strong fermenter, slight sulfur and low diacetyl.

-K0jLdGjyClpd-B_hTns.name: Southwold Ale
-K0jLdGjyClpd-B_hTns.notes: From Suffolk county. Products complex fruity and citrus flavors. Slight sulfer production, but this will fade with ageing.

-K0jLdGjyClpd-B_hTnt.name: Special Ale
-K0jLdGjyClpd-B_hTnt.notes: Highly attentive, clean finish dry yeast.

-K0jLdGlB-cmKO5zc_yn.name: Steinberg-Geisenheim Wine
-K0jLdGlB-cmKO5zc_yn.notes: German origin wine yeast. High fruit/ester production. Moderate fermentation characteristics and cold tolerant.

-K0jLdGnN5Z0qnSUCE_5.bestFor: Very high gravity beers and barley wine up to 25% alcohol.
-K0jLdGnN5Z0qnSUCE_5.name: Super High Gravity Ale
-K0jLdGnN5Z0qnSUCE_5.notes: Ferments up to 25% alcohol content. Flavor may vary greatly depending on beer alcohol. English like esters at low gravity, but will become more wine-like as alcohol exceeds 16% ABV. Refer to White Labs web page for tips on fermenting high gravity ales.

-K0jLdH2XjfYd9_jjz75.name: Sweet Mead/Wine
-K0jLdH2XjfYd9_jjz75.notes: Lower attenuation than White Labs Champagne Yeast. Leaves some residual sweetness as well as fruity flavor. Alcohol concentration up to 15%.

-K0jLdH3-EwQ3_k0ZUKw.bestFor: British Bitters, ESB, India Pale Ale, English Strong Ale
-K0jLdH3-EwQ3_k0ZUKw.name: Thames Valley Ale
-K0jLdH3-EwQ3_k0ZUKw.notes: Clean, complex flavor. Low in fruit, low in esters, rich in flavor. Hops come through well.

-K0jLdH5ViOTU7LPCHJW.bestFor: Trappist Ale, Dubbel, Trippel, Belgian Ales
-K0jLdH5ViOTU7LPCHJW.name: Trappist Ale
-K0jLdH5ViOTU7LPCHJW.notes: Distinctive fruitiness and plum characteristics. Excellent for high gravity beers.

-K0jLdH7vp2VWlJI2JIs.bestFor: Belgian Wit, Trappist Ale, High gravity ales
-K0jLdH7vp2VWlJI2JIs.name: Trappist High Gravity
-K0jLdH7vp2VWlJI2JIs.notes: Robust top cropping yeast. Phenolic character and alcohol tolerance up to 12%. Rich ester profile and malty flavor.

-K0jLdH97NlREPvSA5tJ.name: Urquell Lager
-K0jLdH97NlREPvSA5tJ.notes: Pilsner Urquell yeast with mild fruit/floral aroma. Very dry and clean on palate with full mouth feel. Subtle malt character. Clean and neutral finish.

-K0jLdHAua-x10xhTOIr.name: Weihenstephan Weizen
-K0jLdHAua-x10xhTOIr.notes: Unique Bavarian wheat yeast that produces the spicy weizen clove and banana flavor. Best when fermented at around 68 deg F.

-K0jLdHBoKINLh9E-hU4.bestFor: Whitbread Ale, British Ales, Pales, Bitters
-K0jLdHBoKINLh9E-hU4.name: Whitbread Ale
-K0jLdHBoKINLh9E-hU4.notes: Slightly more fruity and malty than Wyeast's British Ale. Clear and highly flocculant.

-K0jLdHBoKINLh9E-hU5.name: Windsor Yeast
-K0jLdHBoKINLh9E-hU5.notes: Clean, well balanced finish. Yeast produces an estery ale with a slighly fresh yeast flavor. Not as quick as the Nottingham. Some bannana aroma.

-K0jLdHC-mT8HcEge2kP.name: Wyeast Ale Blend
-K0jLdHC-mT8HcEge2kP.notes: Blend of ale strains designed to provide quick starts, good flavor, balance and flocculation. Balanced finish suitable for most American and British ale styles.

-K0jLdHDpkFH_f0X7I8L.name: Wyeast Lager Blend
-K0jLdHDpkFH_f0X7I8L.notes: Blend of lager strains to produce a complex but clean lager flavor profile. Suitable for many common lager styles.

-K0jLdHE8p3HKxbsOrkr.bestFor: Swiss style lager, and high gravity lagers (over 11% ABV)
-K0jLdHE8p3HKxbsOrkr.name: Zurich Lager
-K0jLdHE8p3HKxbsOrkr.notes: Swiss style lager yeast. Sulfer and diacytl production is minimal. May be used for high gravity lagers with proper care.

-K0jLdHFT3zVdudpNmC4.bestFor: Trappist Belgian Ales, Dubbels, Tripels and Specialty ales
-K0jLdHFT3zVdudpNmC4.name: Abbey IV Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHFT3zVdudpNmC4.notes: An authentic Trappist style ale yeast. Use for Belgian ales including abbey ales (dubbels, tripels). Fruit character is medium - between WLP500 (high) and WLP530 (low)

-K0jLdHGSbYRKKHQmvDF.name: American Ale Yeast Blend
-K0jLdHGSbYRKKHQmvDF.notes: A blend that celebrates WLP001 (California Ale Yeast's) clean, neutral fermentation. This strain is versatile and adds two other yeast strains that are also clean/neutral in flavor to add a bit of complexity - almost a lager like finish. Slight sulfur m

-K0jLdHGSbYRKKHQmvDG.name: American Farmhouse Blend
-K0jLdHGSbYRKKHQmvDG.notes: Inspired by local American brewers crafting semi- traditional Belgian-style ales. This blend creates a complex flavor profile with a moderate level of sourness. It consists of a traditional farmhouse yeast strain and Brettanomyces. Great yeast for farmho

-K0jLdHH_PvH68QctMue.name: Antwerp Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHH_PvH68QctMue.notes: Clean, almost lager like Belgian ale yeast. Good for Belgian pale and amber ales or with other Belgian yeasts in a blend. Biscuity, ale like aroma present. Hop flavors are accentuated. Slight sulfur during fermentation, and a lager like flavor profile

-K0jLdHIO2enTjvQjN7q.name: Assmanshausen Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHIO2enTjvQjN7q.notes: German red wine yeast, which results in spicy, fruit aromas. Perfect for Pinot Noir and Zinfandel. Slow to moderate fermenter which is cold tolerant. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

-K0jLdHK8qklRr7gYJTx.name: Australian Ale
-K0jLdHK8qklRr7gYJTx.notes: Produces a malty, bready, nutty character with a pleasant honey like finish. This yeast emphasizes malt nuances and is very forgiving in warmer fermentations for those who cannot ferment under controlled conditions.

-K0jLdHLFkk0uqXgYvez.name: Avize Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHLFkk0uqXgYvez.notes: Champagne isolate used for complexity in whites. Contributes elegance, especially in barrel fermented Chardonnays. Alcohol tolerance to 15%.

-K0jLdHNjGJo5P840DUy.bestFor: European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers
-K0jLdHNjGJo5P840DUy.name: Belgian Lager Yeast
-K0jLdHNjGJo5P840DUy.notes: Clean, crisp European lager yeast with low sulfur production. The strain originates from a very old brewery in West Belgium. Great for European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers.

-K0jLdHOAqftk89nDeHQ.name: Belgian Saison II Yeast
-K0jLdHOAqftk89nDeHQ.notes: Saison strain with a more fruity ester profile than WLP565 (Belgian Saison I Yeast). Moderately phenolic with a clove-like characteristic in finished beer flavor and aroma. Ferments quickly.

-K0jLdHPDAmScVLcNia9.name: Belgian Sour Mix 1
-K0jLdHPDAmScVLcNia9.notes: Note: Bacteria to use in secondary only. A unique blend perfect for Belgian style beers. Includes Brettanomyces, Saccharomyces, and the bacterial strains Lactobacillus and Pediococcus.

-K0jLdHPDAmScVLcNiaA.bestFor: Belgian dark strongs, Abbey ales and Christmas beers
-K0jLdHPDAmScVLcNiaA.name: Belgian Strong Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHPDAmScVLcNiaA.notes: From the Ardennes region of Belgium, this classic strain produces moderate esters and spicy phenolic character. Results in a dry but balanced finish. Use for dark or strong abbey ales.

-K0jLdHQDn6bQ_EpZ_Iz.name: Belgian Style Saison Ale Yeast Blend
-K0jLdHQDn6bQ_EpZ_Iz.notes: This blend melds Belgian style ale and Saison strains. The strains work in harmony to create complex, fruity aromas and flavors. The blend of yeast strains encourages complete fermentation in a timely manner. Phenolic, spicy, earthy, and clove like flavor

-K0jLdHRRgrYtRM-jLZ-.name: Berliner Weisse Blend
-K0jLdHRRgrYtRM-jLZ-.notes: A blend of a traditional German Weizen yeast and Lactobacillus to create a subtle, tart, drinkable beer. Can take several months to develop tart character. Perfect for traditional Berliner Weisse.

-K0jLdHSrwLwT_jVM3ms.bestFor: Belgian sour ales and labics (in secondary)
-K0jLdHSrwLwT_jVM3ms.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
-K0jLdHSrwLwT_jVM3ms.notes: Medium intensity Brett character. Classic strain used in secondary fermentation for Belgian style beers and lambics. One Trappist brewery uses this strain in secondary fermentation.

-K0jLdHTxkMyU5lPJPjG.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
-K0jLdHTxkMyU5lPJPjG.notes: This strain of wild yeast was isolated from brewery cultures in the Brussels region of Belgium. It produces the classic sweaty horse blanket character and may form a pellicle in bottles or casks. The strain is generally used in conjunction with S. cerevis

-K0jLdHUosBcgAlVfqq-.name: Brettanomyces Claussenii
-K0jLdHUosBcgAlVfqq-.notes: Low intensity Brett character. Originally isolated from strong English stock beer, in the early 20th century. The Brett flavors produced are more subtle than WLP650 and WLP653. More aroma than flavor contribution. Fruity, pineapple like aroma.

-K0jLdHVsaMhfxIR3KYq.name: Brettanomyces Lambicus
-K0jLdHVsaMhfxIR3KYq.notes: Use in secondary. High intensity Brett character. Defines the "Brett character": Horsey, smoky and spicy flavors. As the name suggests, this strain is found most often in Lambic style beers, which are spontaneously fermented beers.

-K0jLdHWk6DLHGXq1JQd.name: Brettanomyces Lambucus
-K0jLdHWk6DLHGXq1JQd.notes: This is a wild yeast strain isolated from Belgian lambic beers. It produces a pie cherry-like flavor and sourness with a distinct Brett character. A pellicle may form in bottles or casks. This strain works best in conjunction with other yeast and lactic b

-K0jLdHXaB217JuLgxaU.bestFor: Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc
-K0jLdHXaB217JuLgxaU.name: Cabernet Red Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHXaB217JuLgxaU.notes: High temperature tolerance. Moderate fermentation speed. Excellent for full-bodied red wines, ester production complements flavor. WLP760 is also suitable for Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

-K0jLdHXaB217JuLgxaV.name: California Pub Ale
-K0jLdHXaB217JuLgxaV.notes: For that classic U.S. small brewery flavor. CL-50 produces terrific American red & pale ale styles. While attenuation is normal, this yeast produces a big, soft, well rounded malt flavor that really lets caramel malt flavors shine.

-K0jLdHYOB3aQW-K-0PR.name: Chardonnay White Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHYOB3aQW-K-0PR.notes: Dry wine yeast. Slight ester production, low sulfur dioxide production. Enhances varietal character. WLP730 is a good choice for all white and blush wines, including Chablis, Chenin Blanc, Semillon, and Sauvignon Blanc. Fermentation speed is moderate. Al

-K0jLdHZwRcKYYUIcaSb.name: Cream Ale Yeast Blend
-K0jLdHZwRcKYYUIcaSb.notes: A blend of ale and lager yeast strains that work together to create a clean, light American lager style ale. A pleasing estery aroma may be perceived. Hop flavors and bitterness are slightly subdued. Slight sulfer will be produced during fermentation f

-K0jLdH_rP44hOYRjbZx.name: Flor Sherry Yeast
-K0jLdH_rP44hOYRjbZx.notes: This yeast develops a film (flor) on the surface of the wine. Creates green almond, granny smith and nougat characteristics found in sherry. Can also be used for Port, Madeira and other sweet styles. For use in secondary fermentation. Slow fermentor. Al

-K0jLdHaB5R5palJQisf.name: French Red Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHaB5R5palJQisf.notes: Classic Bordeaux yeast for red wine fermentations. Moderate fermentation characteristics. Tolerates lower fermentation temperatures. Rich, smooth flavor profile. Alcohol Tolerance: 17%

-K0jLdHb_zRYQZfMZcIc.bestFor: French and Belgian Saison or Farmhouse ales
-K0jLdHb_zRYQZfMZcIc.name: French Saison
-K0jLdHb_zRYQZfMZcIc.notes: A very versatile strain that produces Saison or farmhouse style biers as well as other Belgian style beers that are highly aromatic (estery), peppery, spicy and citrusy. This strain enhances the use of spices and aroma hops, and is extremely attenuative b

-K0jLdHcTLPf3L3cqB14.name: French White Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHcTLPf3L3cqB14.notes: Classic yeast for white wine fermentation. Slow to moderate fermenter and foam producer. Gives an enhanced creamy texture. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

-K0jLdHdVfaYoBGX_Eta.name: Lactobacillus
-K0jLdHdVfaYoBGX_Eta.notes: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from a Belgian brewery. This culture produces moderate levels of acidity and is commonly found in many types of beers including gueuze, lambics, sour brown ales and Berliner Weisse. It is always used in conjunction with S.cer

-K0jLdHfVASB1894CeU1.bestFor: Lambic, Berliner Weiss, Sour Brown and Gueze (secondary)
-K0jLdHfVASB1894CeU1.name: Lactobacillus Bacteria
-K0jLdHfVASB1894CeU1.notes: Bacteria for use in secondary. This lactic acid bacteria produces moderate levels of acidity and sour flavors found in lambics, Berliner Weiss, sour brown ale and gueze.

-K0jLdHgiPw2AGh-ECn0.name: Malolactic Bacteria
-K0jLdHgiPw2AGh-ECn0.notes: Bacteria for use in secondary. Malolactic fermentation is the conversion of malic acid to lactic acid by bacteria from the lactic acid bacteria family. Lactic acid is less acidic than malic acid, which in turn decreases acidity and helps to soften and/o

-K0jLdHhrpaMy3h14Jn3.name: Manchester Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHhrpaMy3h14Jn3.notes: Top fermenting strain that is good for top-cropping. Moderately flocculent with a clean, dry finish. Low ester profile for producing a balanced English ale.

-K0jLdHiFBCyDn5OHeLV.bestFor: Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon
-K0jLdHiFBCyDn5OHeLV.name: Merlot Red Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHiFBCyDn5OHeLV.notes: Neutral, low fusel alcohol production. Will ferment to dryness, alcohol tolerance to 18%. Vigorous fermenter. WLP740 is well suited for Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon. Alcohol Tolerance: 18%

-K0jLdHjHHXY-bdRcAtz.name: Octoberfest Lager Blend
-K0jLdHjHHXY-bdRcAtz.notes: This blend of lager strains is designed to produce a rich, malty, complex and full bodied Octoberfest style beer. It attenuates well while leaving plenty of malt character and mouthfeel. This strain is low in sulfur production.

-K0jLdHkPlev-9gen2ZM.name: Pediococcus
-K0jLdHkPlev-9gen2ZM.notes: Lactic acid bacteria used in the production of Belgian style beers where additional acidity is desirable. Often found in gueuze and other Belgian style beer. Acid production will increase with storage time. It may also cause ropiness and produce low level

-K0jLdHlXIbj5GMgK-BR.name: Sake Yeast
-K0jLdHlXIbj5GMgK-BR.notes: For use in rice based fermentations. For sake, use this yeast in conjunction with Koji (to produce fermentable sugar). WLP705 produces full body sake character, and subtle fragrance. Alcohol tolerance to 16%.

-K0jLdHmFoINqyp67sEj.name: Scottish Ale
-K0jLdHmFoINqyp67sEj.notes: Use for classic Scottish heavys, 90's- or strong ales. This yeast produces a soft, fruity malt profile with a subtle woody, oakey ester profile. A mild, mineral like dryness in the finish makes this a very complex strain.

-K0jLdHnVPqooALkZOfQ.name: Suremain Burgundy Wine Yeast
-K0jLdHnVPqooALkZOfQ.notes: Emphasizes fruit aromas in barrel fermentations. High nutrient requirement to avoid volatile acidity production.  Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

-K0jLdHorpObWDT_gWSC.name: Swiss Lager
-K0jLdHorpObWDT_gWSC.notes: A unique strain that has both a clean, crisp lager flavor and a soft, smooth maltiness. Perfect for European Pilsners. Like our CL-660 strain, this is an excellent all purpose Lager yeast for those wanting a fuller, rounder palate.

-K0jLdHphTn3v2pdy5ar.bestFor: English pale ales, English brown ales and Mild ales
-K0jLdHphTn3v2pdy5ar.name: Yorkshire Square Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHphTn3v2pdy5ar.notes: This yeast produces a malty but well balanced profile. Expect toasty flavors with malt driven esters. Highly flocculent and a good choice for many English ales.

-K0jLdHrDnSykPJVI6ZJ.name: Blanche Ale Yeast
-K0jLdHrDnSykPJVI6ZJ.notes: Top fermenting strain for Belgian witbier and wheats. Spicy and lightly phenolic.

-K0jLdHsLxN81q72p4gS.name: Diamond Lager
-K0jLdHsLxN81q72p4gS.notes: Diamond Lager yeast originated in Germany and is used in a number of commercial breweries to produce various lagers.

-K0jLdHt2J8WdC4-IkRL.name: Lager Yeast
-K0jLdHt2J8WdC4-IkRL.notes: A dry lager yeast with high attenuation. Ferments clean and malty.

-K0jLdHt2J8WdC4-IkRM.name: Munuch
-K0jLdHt2J8WdC4-IkRM.notes: Danstar Munich Wheat Beer yeast originated in Bavaria, Germany, the home of many of the world’s great wheat beer breweries.

-K0jLdHuii3uRYo4zqDO.bestFor: American ale, other clean finish ales
-K0jLdHuii3uRYo4zqDO.name: Safale American
-K0jLdHuii3uRYo4zqDO.notes: American ale yeast that produces well balanced beers with low diacetyl and a very clean, crisp end palate.

-K0jLdHv3xMTiFbqvoCC.name: Safbrew Wheat
-K0jLdHv3xMTiFbqvoCC.notes: A specialty yeast for wheat beer fermentation. The yeast produces a subtle estery and phenlol flavor typical of wheat beers.

-K0jLdHwutEYHrJvyBia.name: Saflager Lager
-K0jLdHwutEYHrJvyBia.notes: A famous yeast strain from Weihenstephan Germany used worldwide in brewing. Their most popular strain for lagers.
